arts.ttl: Emre Can criticises Borussia Dortmund’s performance in Barcelona
arts.sum: Borussia Dortmund will need a miracle if they are to qualify for a place in the UEFA Champions League semi-final after their 4-0 hammering against Barcelona on Tuesday night. Speaking…

arts.ttl: Lewandowski doubles up as Barcelona dominate Dortmund to close on semis
arts.athr: Sid Lowe at the Estadi Olímpic Lluís Companys
arts.sum: There is another game to be played but on this evidence, Barcelona will do so for just the fun of it, and there may be no one having as much fun as they are right now. A semi-final place is virtually secure with a second leg to spare after all three of their fantastic forward line scored on route to a 4-0 victory over Borussia Dortmund at Montjuic, the last of them scored by a kid who even at 17 may have a case to be considered the best player on the continent. Robert Lewandowski, with two, and Raphinha got the others, taking Barcelona to 144 goals this season and almost certainly to the next round and perhaps beyond. They will take some stopping; Dortmund couldn’t do it, certainly. only momentarily did they even get close on a night that began and ended with Barcelona. Continue reading...
